description: Build with MSBuild and set the Visual Studio version property

inputs.name: solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the solution(s) or MSBuild project to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.
inputs.label: Solution

inputs.name: vsVersion
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the preferred version cannot be found, the latest version found will be used instead.
inputs.label: Visual Studio Version

inputs.name: platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the platform you want to build such as Win32, x86, x64 or any cpu.
inputs.label: Platform

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the configuration you want to build such as debug or release.
inputs.label: Configuration

inputs.name: clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to False if you want to make this an incremental build.
inputs.label: Clean

inputs.name: maximumCpuCount
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your MSBuild target configuration is compatible with building in parallel, you can optionally check this input to pass the /m switch to MSBuild (Windows only). If your target configuration is not compatible with building in parallel, checking this option may cause your build to result in file-in-use errors, or intermittent or inconsistent build failures.
inputs.label: Build in Parallel

inputs.name: restoreNugetPackages
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option is deprecated. To restore NuGet packages, add a [NuGet Tool Installer](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/tasks/tool/nuget) task before the build.
inputs.label: Restore NuGet Packages

inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of MSBuild to run.
inputs.name: msbuildArchitecture
inputs.label: MSBuild Architecture

inputs.name: logProjectEvents
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally record timeline details for each project.
inputs.label: Record Project Details

inputs.name: createLogFile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally create a log file (Windows only).
inputs.label: Create Log File

inputs.name: enableDefaultLogger
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true - enables default logger for msbuild
inputs.label: Enable Default Logger

inputs.name: customVersion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows setting custom version of Visual Studio. Examples: 15.0, 16.0, 17.0. Make sure that the required version of Visual Studio is installed in the system.
inputs.label: Custom Version
